statement:
Let $C\subset B\subset A$ be rings. If $B$ is integral over $C$ and $A$
is integral over $B$, then $A$ is integral over $C$.

**Proof.** Choose $u\in A$. Then
$u^n+b_1 u^{n-1}+\cdots+b_n=0, b_i\in B$. Thus $C[b_1,\ldots,b_n,u]$ is
integral and thus module-finite over $C[b_1,\ldots,b_n]$. Each $b_i$ is
integral over $C$, so $C[b_1,\ldots,b_n]$ is integral hence
module-finite over $C$. Thus $C[b_1,\ldots,b_n,u]$ is module-finite,
hence integral, over $C$, so $u$ is integral over $C$.
